timeline.message:
Reader UT coverage bumped to 80%

* Enabled tests which were disabled and not flaky

* Changed the file reading format in the MetricProcessor Tests

* Refactored the class MetricsParser which is not used anymore.

timeline.bodyText: Why are we not using MetricsParesr.extractEntryData ?
timeline.author: yojs
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -739,6 +737,29 @@ public void emitNodeMetrics(long currWindowStartTime, MetricsDB metricsDB) throw
     }
   }
 
+  /**
+   * An example value is this: current_time:1566413987194 StartTime:1566413987194 ItemCount:359
+   * IndexName:nyc_taxis ShardID:25 Primary:true Each pair is separated by new line and the key and
+   * value within each pair is separated by ":" This function just parses the string and generates
+   * the map as such.
+   *
+   * @param eventValue The value input to the helper function.
+   * @return Returns a map of key value pairs
+   */
+  static Map<String, String> extractEntryData(String eventValue) {
+    String[] lines = eventValue.split(System.lineSeparator());

replies.bodyText: I have removed the file MetricsParser.java altogether. None of the functions in it were being used and only this method was being used in a few places.
replies.author: aditjind

timeline.message: Updating to Generate UTs Coverage Report for all packages

timeline.bodyText: nit: Maybe make this an instance variable, or initialize this in before() so that you don't have to do this on every test case.
timeline.author: ktkrg

replies.bodyText: I have updated that in the latest version.
